name: Huss Afzal

company.name: Deputy
company.description: Developer of a workforce management platform designed to simplify employee scheduling, timesheets, tasking, and communication. The company's platform provides work scheduling and people management skills by eliminating manual processes and paper-based systems along with social and mobile technologies at its core, enabling businesses to save time and money by empowering managers and employees to work fast and smart with intelligent work scheduling, timesheet management, and communication tools.

achievements: Reduced marketing spend by 70% with a 6% increase in conversions, due to optimisation of marketing strategies
Optimised existing customer base contracts by offering guaranteed annual contracts to specific customers instead of monthly rates, increasing annual recurring revenue by 24%
Rolled out price increase to the customer base by doing sensitivity analysis and external benchmarking to determine overall effectiveness. Increasing existing revenue by 16%
Delivered a 100% engagement score for the data team, an increase of 74% in 12 months
Led the execution of multiple A:B testing results to improve customer NPS
Introduced data strategies for the roll out of new product offerings, including experimentation framework to improve the product and increase conversion
Introduced data science models to predict churn and user expansion opportunities
Lead the roll out of dbt for the transformation layer, creating highly reliable data
Built an enterprise grade data model
Worked closely with the senior leadership team to plan, develop, coordinate and execute data and commercial strategies.
Developed new data products that improved ROI for the various cross functional initiatives
Created and executed the data strategy, set the roadmap for data engineering, analytics and data science
Led the integration of the analytics warehouse with core systems to enable single source of truth and optimise calculation
Setup automatic operational and warehouse alerting to notify and mitigate any large spends in inefficient queries

company.name: Inchcape plc
company.description: Inchcape plc (LSE: INCH) is a British multinational automotive distribution, retail and services company headquartered in London, United Kingdom. An outgrowth of Calcutta-based Mackinnon Mackenzie Company, Inchcape has operations in 32 countries across Asia, Australia, Europe, Africa and South America. Inchcape is listed on the London Stock Exchange and is a constituent of the FTSE 250 Index.

responsibilties: Create the strategy and roadmap for an environment that makes data and information accessible to all departments and personnel across the business.
Provide expertise and consult on all major data-related initiatives inclusive of personnel recruiting, development, and retention within the business.
Create and sustain a vibrant data organization, technologies, processes, and policies within the department and across the business.
Provide analysis and analytics, including ML to enable revenue growth and cost reduction
Unify and Standardise financial, operational, external, management data structures and systems across all departments & brands
Develop, implement and roll out regional Business Intelligence, advanced analytics and data strategy
Lead the Business Intelligence team for inchcape globally to provide insights and analytics to enable and support key business decision making across all departments
Provide strategic initiatives & guidance through insights and modelling including competitor, economic and geographical analysis
Set up and lead the RPA team to introduce automation and efficiencies throughout the business, including deciding on Vendor, preparing the roll out strategy and actioning the strategy into go live

Roll out SAP locally as the operational and finance lead  for Subaru Australia and Trivett Automotive Retail, working with the global team and local teams to make sure that it is a scalable product that can be taken to other markets and can fit in with the BI strategy as well as the global systems implementation strategy
Streamline and improve business processes by utilising technology and efficient workflows
Business partner with operations, sales, marketing, general accounting, tax and legal to achieve business results and hit set forecasts
Lead quarterly forecasting and budgeting cycles as well as Weekly forecast, ensuring accuracy and commentary with analysis on variances to actuals
Provide mentorship, develop career and training plans for the team
Reduced manual touch points for business processes
Manage cash flow for the group and the business units
achievements: Automated reporting using BI technology from SAP HANA, Webi & Power BI and insights delivered in real time to key stakeholders through Azure Databricks, Data factory and Synapse

Integral lead in business transformation, introducing technology in order to automate and streamline processing and shift the business away from manual processing of data to garnering meaning and insights from data and creating efficient processes to enable time saving for employees.
As part of transformation successfully introduced and integrated data frameworks for multiple systems in the form of SAP BPC, Alteryx, Blackline, COUPA, Concur, Power BI, UiPath
RPA setup for Accounts Receivable, payable and Treasury. Strategy built and best practices laid out, including governance and controls for audit, control and compliance purposes
Created high performing data, automation and insights teams built from the ground up, including recruiting, training, and upskilling
Everything delivered from architecture to proof of concept for a cloud based solution to manage customer interactions with the Retail business

Commissions portal developed to aid payroll in managing and updating the commissions structures for salesman payout. Includes loading of data, automatically calculating a payout figure based on the matrix as well as approval mechanism to capture and meet the controls framework and audit requirements
Developed a dashboard that merged online analytics (Google, facebook, instagram) with financial and operational, foot traffic data to create effectiveness of campaigns and ROI

Trained a machine learning algorithm to predict the optimum inventory level in order to lower the amount of time vehicles spend in the dealership. Using python, and scikit-learn; and order take, enquiry, leads, previous history on shape changes data, popularity of colour to predict

Trained a neural network AI to identify positive and negative expressions in tweets. It then labels the tweets as overall positive/negative/neutral/irrelevant, to track brand loyalty and ad effectiveness based on customer sentiment across all brands

Group consolidation automated through technology to deliver a seamless and integrated forecasting process for the Australasia Business units which encompasses automated actuals loads and submission to the UK group through SAP BPC

company.name: Woolworths Limited
company.description: Woolworths Limited is a major Australian company with extensive retail interest throughout Australia and New Zealand. It is the second largest company in Australia by revenue, and the second largest in New Zealand. In addition, Woolworths Limited is the largest takeaway liquor retailer in Australia, the largest retailer in the world in 2008

responsibilties: Provide reporting and analysis of actual Sales and GP for trading department
Provide accurate forecasting of future Sales and GP for trading department
Provide insightful analysis and decision support to the Merchandise Manager and Category Managers
Identify and implement opportunities that improve processes across the Commercial Finance Team
Participate in annual budget and strategic plan processes
Be the finance Seat at the table for Trading Department through strong Business Partnering Skills
achievements: Improved Weekly Reporting, reduced grunt work in preparing reporting through system efficiencies, New process saved 3.5 hours a week
Recreated the Weekly forecast file for FY17, which was replicated for Other Departments (Bakery and Seafood)
Introduced Visualisations into Sub-Category Forecast builds to allow Category Managers to easily understand the impact of their Promotional Mix

company.name: News Corp Australia
company.description: News Corp Australia (formerly News Limited) is one of Australia's largest media companies, employing more than 8,000 staff nationwide and approximately 3,000 journalists. The publicly listed company's interests span newspaper and magazine publishing, Internet, pay TV, market research, DVD and film distribution, and film and television production trading assets.

responsibilties: Financially responsible for Digital performance of the NSW and The Australian Mastheads, including Revenue, Cost and Analytics
Proactively identify and implement reporting and systematic efficiencies across all mastheads
Making sure the Digital performance of the brands is best optimised to achieve goals, through analysis and understanding
Gauging effectiveness of marketing campaigns, editorial content, digital sales and advertising performance of the NSW and The Australian Mastheads
Business Partnering with department heads, to help them better control their cost centre. Includes creating dashboards, graphs and other tools to help understanding.
Prepare Annual budgeting and quarterly forecast in accordance with Company policies, IFRS and SOX
Prepare and action Month End and provide commentary on allocated Departments on a Weekly, Monthly, quarterly and annual basis
Find Opportunities for improvement in procedures within the Finance team and broader business
achievements: Promoted Twice Internally

Developed Daily Dashboards that aided in the decision making of the senior leadership team. The dashboard is presented to the state director of NSW, as well as Senior NSW Advertising and sales leaders on a daily basis powered by Business Objects and TM1.

Developed Leave dashboard reporting that helps every department for NSW Mastheads, as well as a national masthead better control their leave planning powered by Workday, Sharepoint and TM1. Saving the department heads time and effectively money for the company.
Developed Daily dashboards that help Editorial better control Pagination and Cost Centre Spend powered by TM1, JDEdwards and Business Objects.

Owned and took initiative in the Digital Side of the business and helped control and report the analysis driving the digital products, including Web, tablet and Mobile, through the use of heavy data-driven products in the form of Google and Adobe Analytics, amongst other smaller sources.
Prepared Forecasts and Budgets for cost centres that have a combined spend of over $160 Million
Ad Hoc Analysis that provided savings across the business
Automated Rate Card for National Operations Newscorp.
Delivered transformation plans with a focus on achievement of specific objectives and targets
Improved internal audit reports and SOX ratings
Highlighted Opportunities for growth and changes to the system

company.name: AAT Kings
company.description: AAT Kings has been showcasing the history, culture and natural splendour of Australia and New Zealand for over 90 years. AAT Kings is part of The Travel Corporation – a group of established and prominent travel companies.

responsibilties: Create a template to build the pricing model through sophisticated analysis and understanding of the business.
Build and maintain pricing for tour packages on offer, globally including 6 different currencies.

Find efficiencies in the reporting and pricing structures

Business Partnered with key management from non-financial divisions to Create the Reporting Packs, analytics and Tools for Finance and Operations
Created ad-hoc dashboard reporting tool that allowed management to run analysis on demand and extract data that was relevant to them from an easy to use interface.

Utilised System Skills to save 6 days of company time a month as well as time spent by 4 additional staff members during this period, when Pricing new tours. This method was adapted by other brands and helped the company globally.
Prepared the global pricing of tours, that was backed by sound analysis and market conditions as well as other products that the company puts up for sale.

company.name: Austar United Communications
company.description: Austar is an Australian telecommunications company. Its main business activity is being the second largest Subscription Television Company in Australia but it is also involved with internet access and mobile phones.

responsibilties: Preparing the market release for the financial quarter
Fixed Asset Maintenance for the Subsidiary Ledger
Completing the Fixed Asset Reconciliation, which consists of 37 different categories and combined items in excess of 15,000
Completing balance sheet reconciliations for accounts, including FBT, payroll, audit fees, R&D, interest payable, management fees, prepayments, due from employees, company credit card.
Completing accruals for expenditure as necessary at month end.
achievements: Created an assets extract report that helped report the accuracy of the fixed assets register and make it easier to spot potential errors as well as outline the issues that need to be resolved for increased effectiveness in the register. This process reduced the time spent on analysis by 3-4 hours daily.

company.description: Edge Digital technology is a wholly owned subsidiary of AHL, and was a newly formed start up at the time, digital deployment happened. They deal with the installation of digital cinema equipment.

Created a database which worked to capture stock and inventory information, this database helped provide managers with useful information that would help in their decision making process of how the stock is being controlled, the location of the stock and why stock is not being received from suppliers. This not only helped the department immensely but also resulted in tens of thousands in savings for the company.
Successfully created databases which met the specific requirements of a particular department and project, thus helping management and operational staff to make critical business decisions.
